metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4036 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The quagga package before 0.99.23-2.6.1 in openSUSE and SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 11 SP 1 uses weak permissions for /etc/quagga, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information by reading files in the directory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4036` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

quagga - 0.99.24.1-2ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> description mentions SUSE, but debian/ubuntu package has similar issue.

criterions.comment: quagga package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.99.24.1-2ubuntu1.1').
